channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump admin appeals judge’s order requiring full SNAP benefits
item.description: The Trump administration isn’t backing down from its refusal to fully fund the SNAP program – even after being ordered to by a judge on Thursday. The ...

item.title: Wendy’s closing hundreds of locations: List of fast food casualties in 2025 grows longer
item.description: Wendy’s announced plans to close a “mid-single-digit percentage” of its underperforming U.S. store locations, or 200 to 350 of some 6,000 locations, d...

item.title: Sweetgreen’s dream of being a tech company is finally dead
item.description: On November 6, Sweetgreen announced that it was selling Spyce, its division that developed and made its Infinite Kitchen technology to automate the as...

item.title: Musk Made 4 Otherworldly Promises for Tesla’s Future In Response to $1 Trillion Pay Deal
item.description: The Tesla CEO is on course to become the world’s first trillionaire.

item.title: Why Some Construction Companies Use This Contractual Clause
item.description: Tariffs are causing chaos for many industries, including construction. Here’s how some companies handle the chaos.

item.title: The 6 Big Tax Updates Wealthy Americans Need to Know—It’s All Good News
item.description: The ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ has several tax law changes impacting anyone making more than $200,000.

item.title: Rockefeller Center’s Christmas Tree cut down in upstate New York, standing a towering 75 feet tall
item.description: The 11-ton tree was loaded onto a 100-foot-long trailer as scores of people turned out for the occasion.

item.title: Hertz sees 20% spike in one-way rentals amid air traffic chaos
item.description: America seems to be hitting the road as its air fleet is increasingly grounded.

item.title: Spirit Christmas is back with 30 pop-up stores: Full list of locations for your holiday shopping needs
item.description: With Black Friday just about three weeks away, retailers and shoppers have one thing on their mind—Christmas, the busiest and most profitable time of ...

item.title: Elise Stefanik, close ally of Trump, announces run for governor of New York
item.description: The upstate New Yorker was previously tapped to become the president's ambassador to the United Nations, although that was pulled.

item.title: This Congresswoman Sees 1 Path to Ending the Government Shutdown
item.description: The country is currently facing the longest government shutdown in American history. What will it take for Congress to end it once and for all?

item.title: After more than 200 years, the ‘Farmers’ Almanac’ is shutting down for good
item.description: Since 1818, loyal readers of the Farmers’ Almanac have turned to the publication for weather predictions, gardening tips, astronomy calendars, and mor...

item.title: Here’s How Many Billions Meta Earned From Ads That Are Trying to Scam You
item.description: An investigation by Reuters revealed that 15 billion ‘high risk’ advertisements reach its users every day.

item.title: Peloton recalls nearly 878,000 exercise bikes after several seat posts break
item.description: Both consumer safety watchdogs and Peloton urge owners of these bikes to stop using them and contact the New York-based exercise company for a free se...

item.title: Asian universities turn into tourist destinations as Chinese students look closer to home for higher education
item.description: Tourists have long flocked to Western universities, like Oxford or Harvard—but visitors are now adding Asian campuses to their itineraries.
